title: Question 1
stimulusHtml: The student response can earn one point for stating that the Roman soldiers are hesitating because of the depth of the sea.
descriptions: The student response does not state that the Roman soldiers are hesitating because of the depth of the sea.
The student response states that the Roman soldiers are hesitating because of the depth of the sea.

title: Question 2
stimulusHtml: The student response can earn one point for identifying the speaker as the soldier who bore the eagle/standard of the tenth legion.
descriptions: The student response does not identify the speaker as the soldier who bore the eagle/standard of the tenth legion.
The student response identifies the speaker as the soldier who bore the eagle/standard of the tenth legion.

title: Question 3
stimulusHtml: The student response can earn one point for stating that the aquilam is important to the soldiers because the soldiers follow where it leads/it serves as a rallying point for the legion/it is the symbol of the Roman army
descriptions: The student response does not state that the aquilam is important to the soldiers because the soldiers follow where it leads/it serves as a rallying point for the legion/it is the symbol of the Roman army
The student response states that the aquilam is important to the soldiers because the soldiers follow where it leads/it serves as a rallying point for the legion/it is the symbol of the Roman army

title: Question 4
stimulusHtml:
The student response can earn one point for either of the following answers:

He throws himself from the ship/jumps off the ship into the water

He begins to carry the eagle against the enemy
descriptions:
The student response does not include one of the possible answers:

He throws himself from the ship/jumps off the ship into the water

He begins to carry the eagle against the enemy

The student response includes one of the possible answers:

He throws himself from the ship/jumps off the ship into the water

He begins to carry the eagle against the enemy

title: Question 5
stimulusHtml:
The student response can earn up to two points: 1 point for the translation and 1 point for the grammatical construction

Translation:

in order that/so that so great a shame not be allowed/lest so great a shame be allowed

in order that/so that so great a disgrace not be incurred/lest so great a disgrace be incurred

Grammatical construction:

negative purpose clause

indirect command [dependent on cohortati]
descriptions:
Student answered NEITHER the translation NOR the grammatical construction correctly

Translation:

in order that/so that so great a shame not be allowed/lest so great a shame be allowed

in order that/so that so great a disgrace not be incurred/lest so great a disgrace be incurred

Grammatical construction:

negative purpose clause

indirect command [dependent on cohortati]

Student answered EITHER the translation OR the grammatical construction correctly

Translation:

in order that/so that so great a shame not be allowed/lest so great a shame be allowed

in order that/so that so great a disgrace not be incurred/lest so great a disgrace be incurred

Grammatical construction:

negative purpose clause

indirect command [dependent on cohortati]

Student answered BOTH the translation AND the grammatical construction correctly

Translation:

in order that/so that so great a shame not be allowed/lest so great a shame be allowed

in order that/so that so great a disgrace not be incurred/lest so great a disgrace be incurred

Grammatical construction:

negative purpose clause

indirect command [dependent on cohortati]

title: Question 6
stimulusHtml:
The student response can earn one point for any of the following answers:

Caesar especially trusts the tenth legion because of its bravery. [Book 1.40]

Caesar had the soldiers of the tenth legion ride on horseback temporarily so that he could have his favorite troops as a bodyguard. In this way, he would not break his agreement with Ariovistus that each could come to their meeting attended only by mounted guards. [Book 1.41-42]

Caesar describes how the tenth legion plays a crucial role in stopping Vercingetorix at Alesia. [Book 7.51]
descriptions:
Student response includes none of the possible answers:

Caesar especially trusts the tenth legion because of its bravery. [Book 1.40]

Caesar had the soldiers of the tenth legion ride on horseback temporarily so that he could have his favorite troops as a bodyguard. In this way, he would not break his agreement with Ariovistus that each could come to their meeting attended only by mounted guards. [Book 1.41-42]

Caesar describes how the tenth legion plays a crucial role in stopping Vercingetorix at Alesia. [Book 7.51]

Student response includes one of the possible answers:

Caesar especially trusts the tenth legion because of its bravery. [Book 1.40]

Caesar had the soldiers of the tenth legion ride on horseback temporarily so that he could have his favorite troops as a bodyguard. In this way, he would not break his agreement with Ariovistus that each could come to their meeting attended only by mounted guards. [Book 1.41-42]

Caesar describes how the tenth legion plays a crucial role in stopping Vercingetorix at Alesia. [Book 7.51]
